alternatives.transcript: the Utica Community Schools an educational setting that is professional yet warm diverse yet unified traditional yet a trendsetter the ingredients that make it uniquely Utica

it's been a good week the kind of week that makes me feel glad I chose teaching as a profession and the kind of week that makes me feel glad I chose the Utica Community Schools as the place to teach every weeks not perfect but the good week's far outnumber the others

education is important to this community and it's reflected in the attitude of the students they're eager to learn and that type of attitude Fosters a strong teacher student educational relationship I guess I'm kind of lucky I'm doing something I always wanted to do and I'm doing it in a group surrounding

Metroid surrounding referred to is not accidental it's the result of hard work and effective planning but mainly it's the result of a Cooperative effort between the community and its schools a unique Community spirit that is the Utica Community Schools a unique Community spirit that finds over 1,200 citizens volunteering their time work with students and teachers in the classroom a community spirit that sees over 200 sir

clubs and organizations donating their time to Make a Better Community and a better local educational system a unique Community spirit that builds roads Bridges and churches and finds the time to build and support the state's best school district a unique Community spirit that is the Utica Community Schools

tonight this spirit is in Rich through the completion of the 1987 citizens advisory committee the most ambitious joint venture between the schools of the community in UCS history nearly 800 residents have donated more than 20,000 hours to design a future for this school district 16 subcommittees and 58 subgroups presented over 1,400 recommendations which were received by the Board of Education last

denied indeed this is a unique Community Spirit the Utica Community Schools has reason to be proud and it's Community has reason to be proud just look around and you'll see the many fruits of our communities cut and it's genuine interest in education we're fortunate to enjoy a Vibrant Community and its nearby amenities and we're fortunate to enjoy a local educational system that

it is not afraid to tackle the future and it will reach out and extract the maximum amount of talent from its students we are fortunate that in Years Gone by people like many of you here tonight took the time to think about their schools and their community
took the time to assemble their ideas dreams and goals and Forge them into plans which result in the schools and communities we enjoy so much today

however we cannot dwell too long in looking exclusively backward we must look forward with hope initiative and planning we must ensure that Educational Opportunity is expanded and refurbished as a society accelerates its demands that our future citizens

the CAC blueprint for tomorrow is a dramatic move forward it has surveyed and staked out many New Roads its members have developed a comprehensive new plan for upgrading and maintaining our physical facilities which stresses the individual safety of students it is looked at the aging process of the buildings and prescribed a remedy that will pump new adrenaline into aging walls and hallways

this exhaustive inspection covered every nook and cranny in the school districts physical structures and resulted in over 1,200 suggestions for upgrading and Improvement these suggestions also include the support facilities and acknowledges their growing role in the overall operation of the school district

the CAC conclave has recommended physical changes to meet the needs and demands of new programs in science language technology vocational education and computers as we plunge headlong into the age of information the citizens report pinpoints the need for additional storage and has addressed the community's increasing requests for preschool programming the 1987
a study by the community encourages the Board of Education to continue its practice of looking to the Future academic needs of its family of students

it sees the need to recapture the scientific leadership so prevalent in Mans race to the moon in the 1960s the roots for this drive for scientific leadership must be planted in the Laboratories of our schools with new equipment and expanded facilities to challenge inquiring minds

business and commerce that once stretched shortish or across Plains and mountains now leaps from continent to continent in Split Second time frame and dictates A Renewed emphasis on foreign language not only in our high schools but also in the fertile and expected minds of our Junior High and elementary students this new Global concept ties hand-in-hand and thus increases the need for information knowledge and communication
cognizant of these needs the 1987 CAC report propels the school district into the future by expanding its use of computers
once the sole property of large corporations and more recently a favorite form of youthful entertainment the computer is now Advanced to a position of major importance in our daily lives

as the plow was once Central to the farmer now the computer touches Us in nearly every life management situation its application to course instruction runs the full length and breadth of the curriculum enhancing and expanding student instruction from science to math to drafting
yeah great cultural Society of 50 years ago was pushed aside by the rapid industrialization of our nation following World War Two

that industrialization is now in the throes of change as new and modern technology replaces and makes obsolete are familiar memes of manufacturing that change is acknowledged in this latest citizen study where the call for an updating of our equipment stressing the Advent and importance of Robotics and other high-tech equipment our future breadwinners will encounter in the production Trade Centers of our nation

this study also takes a bold step and recommending the blending of basic English Math and Science courses into the vocational setting it is an important Link in forming a partnership of business and education for tomorrow the 1987 citizens advisory committee study also Mel's the new high-tech of the information age with classroom instruction new technology

the form of computers television laserdiscs and telecommunication strategies has the potential to drastically affect the education of our elementary and secondary students this transition to modern technology and Society is mirrored in the classroom as teachers seek new audio and visual resources to supplement their instruction

the investigations by the citizens K-12 curriculum committee coupled with a school districts ongoing standards of quality process provides the Board of Education with a springboard to the next five years and Beyond the interest in what is being taught in the school districts classrooms is so Keen that 13 subgroups were eventually formed within the curriculum Spectrum from these groups came recommendations for early childhood

education Fine Arts foreign language gifted and talented programs help education special education and guidance and counseling to name a few all of these recommendations are designed to improve quality of educational life in the Utica Community Schools a Common Thread running through the fabric of the CAC report is the need for more in service for the school

districts certified and non-certified staffs the infusion of new techniques new materials new products and modern technology requires familiarization and the exchange of information this familiarization and information exchange translates into more effective classroom instruction for the student body and while the major portion of the study Dells

the physical structures and curriculum upgrading the humanistic side of education has not forgotten one group of the community undertook the task of piloting a national parrot adolescent mitigation project this group's goal was and is to foster a positive interaction between parents and adolescents based on more effective communication by both adults and youth this

I'm weaves together a variety of community services to promote communication skills and activities the energies and talents of the 1987 CAC populace for together to form a stream of Consciousness for the future but in reality this stream will be a languid Brook without a means of providing the finances for these proposals

an unknown author once proclaimed if you think education is expensive try ignorance with this in mind the study group has developed a ledger for the future with a fiscal managerial plan to accommodate eutychus journey into the centuries final decade this community has demonstrated time and time again on issues vital to the quality of local education its desire to support

silence the members of the 1987 citizens advisory committee can now begin to enjoy the fruits of their labors many hours away from home and family spent in collecting data analyzing these melding ideas forming a consensus this enormous commitment will be returned many times over because our 25,000 youngsters turn a textbook page

experiment with a chemical formula or read a printer it will be returned many times over as these youngsters filter into adulthood and stake their claims as part of the community as Cicero once said what greater or better gift can we offer the Republic then to teach and instruct are you you me
and the person next to you will swell with pride knowing that our efforts provided a better tomorrow
